comment: Test are so hard and random questions. If you spell something wrong you don't get a point. Test are not from PPT or text book. THEY ARE RANDOM. JUST dont take him trust me It's worth it to wait a semster or a year for another professor but dont take him.

I hope ksu do something about him. He set you up for failure and is so proud about it. He literally enjoys when students withdraw of fail the class. He literally make a graph of students failure and low grades and laughed about it in 1st day of class to scare other students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I had him last semester, and he's honestly a great guy. But his class is not for the faint of heart, and it is, without a doubt, incredibly difficult—I used to drive to class without a seatbelt, half-hoping for an accident to get me out of it.

Reads through lecture slides and assigns long homework, exams are difficult with the class average being in the 50s, and seems proud because he 'makes the best exams.' If you see that your class is struggling and it isn't the first time students have withdrawn/failed, you're a terrible professor. Do better, there's a reason why you get criticized.

His exams are difficult. multiple choice, fill in the blank, and short answer. his lectures are impossible to follow because he just reads off the slides and goes through them fast. "confronted" us about not showing up to class explained to him that his lectures are difficult to follow and then made an excuse instead of trying to help DONT TAKE HIM
Pick anyone but him. His test are extremely hard. He makes a handful of questions about something he went over for 2 minutes. If u have to take him, read the textbook!!

cant teach, attendance mandatory which makes no sense bc he CAN'T teach. exam averages of 50s and below which he is PROUD OF.  can do hw's to help grade which take hours to do every week. do. not. take. him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Confuses himself, skips several slides and rushes cause he goes on rants for 20-30 minutes, all test averages were failing, makes excuses when he asks for honest criticism, bad attitude, went a month and a half without an exam twice, covers 7-8 chapters yet asks minute details that are hard to remember and has short tests in comparison to material.

Class is difficult but not impossible. Prof lets you choose how you are graded (ie can do homework and make tests less heavy, or not do homework). Attendance mandatory and 10% of your grade. Graded by few things but HW you have unlimited attempts to get a 100%. Read the textbook and do all the extra practice problems and you will succeed.

Ive never rated a professor but I have to warn people about him. His class is structured terribly. He confuses himself, then confuses the class. Hes very proud that his class is hard and after the first test suggested most students change their major. class averages never made it out the 30s. fill in the blank test with no word bank. dont take!
He's a rude guy wo doesn't believe in wearing masks for COVID even though he's a virology professor. Its ridiculous

He is a great professor. One of the most enjoyable lectures ive ever sat through although he does seem to trip over himself quite a bit which leads to a little confusion. Test grades are often low but are on a curve.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: Dr. McMurry isn't as bad as the reviews make him seem. The class is lectures and 3 test. The final replaces lowest test grade. He does lecture pretty fast and pack as much information he can. He is a pretty understanding professor and you can go to him for help. Wouldn't be my first choice, but he's not that bad.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: STAY AWAY!!!  This guy does NOT know how to teach or test at an undergraduate level. He said "I teach at a graduate level because that's where you'll be going" Granted, most sudents do go on for higher degrees, but that doesnt excuse the fact that he PURPOSFULLY TROLLS THE CLASS TO FAIL, A 54 TEST AVERAGE ON THE FIRST TEST AND HE SAID THIS WAS GOOD
Stay away far away!! He  purposely will go out of his way to make students fail.  He teaches at a graduate level (why?) and if you value your GPA take him at your own risk.

Do. Not. Take. Dr. McMurry is stressful to be around. He starts off the semester with intimidation tactics that are just unnecessary and stupid. He is not very good at explaining things. He blows through material and has a way of answering questions that gives the impression that he likes the sound of his own voice too much. AVOID.

Dr. McMurry is a great teacher! He is very helpful..  He is available to listen to concerns of the students and offer advice.  Also very funny!  I really liked his LCA point system, it gives you a chance to earn bonus points and improve your grade!

3 tests 1 final. Final can replace 1 low test grade. Do all quizzes and LCAs do not wait till the last minute (they are harder than you think). Not an easy class - this is Biochem. He's a realistic professor & worth it in the end.

3 tests 1 final. Final replaces lower test grade. Do all the online quizzes and the LCAs (they are not as easy as you would think). He makes you think and  you have to work for your grade.  But stick it out - it's worth it. Very realistic professor.

This is a hard class but not impossible. You HAVE to read the book to do well. Its detailed, but not impossible. There is lots of room for bonus as long as you go to class everyday, and do all the extra problems he gives you. He's really helpful outside of class and fair. Will really help you for grad/prof school. I recommend Dr. M.

He understands the material very well, but does not know how to convey it to an audience that does not already have previous knowledge of the subject.  He has a somewhat likable personality, but he can be very rude at times. His tests are hard so go to class and take a lot of notes. Not a lover of partial credit. It is not an impossible course.

a hard class, but that's not his fault.  he is fair and that's all that matters.  none of us are here for a popularity contest, so just because some don't like him doesn't really have anything to do with how he teaches.  he's friendly and fair but will demand only the best from you.
He once told me i had no chance getting in medical field, months later i got my admission letter to a medical sch. Don't let anyone limit ur capability, mcmurry is good at doing jst that.

He is ok. Could be better at explaining and providing more information about the subject. Overall a nice guy. Make sure you write good reports. No tests, and few quizes (easy ones). Only lab reports....which makes things easy.

Not a good teacher = He is teaching at KSU becasue he has to in order to do reasearch. Not a people person. Dont expect to get the answer you are looking for...he will tell you a whole different story and at the end will not even remember what was your question.Read the textbook and look for sample test online before his test.
Best Professor at Kennesaw State University. Do the homework and read notes/book, and you will succeed.
Final was hard because it was fill in the blank. Gave quizzes throughout the semester. Cracks corny jokes. Not a bad guy though......

McMurry is a great prof. He bends over backward for students diligent in their work. If someone has a hard time, their work ethic/study skills are questionable. Biochemisty is not for the faint at heart...then again neither is med school. So if your complaining maybe you should rethink career choices!
The previous comment must have been written by a failure.

Very good instructor who knows his stuff.  If you are only expecting to float through lower level chem course, this is not the professor for you.  If you can't take an instructor who expects the most from you in an upper level course, then what are you doing in chemistry?  Highly recommended for the serious chem major who wants to learn.

Best prof at ksu.  cares for his students success, motivated to teach, and delivers lectures clearly.  he is a hard teacher, but you will learn what is important.  Invest your time and you will succeed.
I took Mcmurry for Chem 1152L. He was pretty cool. Cracked jokes. Offered as much help as needed. Gave a few pop quizzes that weren't too difficult.  Final was pretty simple bc he gave a study guide
Dr. McMurry is hard, but that is only b/c he teaches to the top-notch students.  He loves his subject and is will to help any time.  Put forth the effort and you will do well.
Difficult, but thorough. Fair. "Rediculous"??? With spelling like this he had a right to give you a rough time.

Since Fall '06 was his first semester, he lacked experience. He's really nice and not picky about the notebook, but he didn't know what a lab teacher is supposed to do. There was no "lecture" to explain the experiments; since the lecture class usually does not follow the lab, student were lost at times. Overall, not a hard class to take.
No Comments

I agree exactly with what the person before me said. He may come across as truly helpful and caring, but after I've had him, I know now its all just a fascade. He is very defensive about his teaching style and although he asked for feedback, he will not take it into consideration. His pop quizzes are difficult and tests are ridiculous!

As a person, he's nice, but not a good teacher. He gets nervous in class and messes up things and sometimes gets confusing. His tests are rediculous. He has anonymous posting on WebCT so we can make suggestions, but rarely listened! Our failure was always OUR fault...not his. I'm sorry, but when half the class is failing ur tests, there's a problem
